official-title.#text:
To authorize the Secretary of Labor to award special recognition to employers for veteran-friendly
			 employment practices.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Honoring the Hiring of Heroes Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Honoring the Hiring of Heroes Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(in this Act
			 referred as the Secretary) and the

shall
			 jointly establish a program to award special recognition to employers for
			 veteran-friendly employment practices and, in coordination with the

, shall establish criteria for
			 determining recipients of such awards.

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
under this Act shall
			 be known as an Employment Salute Award.

text.#text: An award of recognition granted under the program established by the

term.#tail:
means any person engaged in a business affecting commerce who has employees, but does not include
			 the United States or any State or political subdivision of a State.

text.#text: As used in this Act, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish different categories of employers eligible for the awards based on
			 the size of the employers. Recognition shall be awarded separately for
			 employers having from 1 to 50 employees, from 51 to 500 employees, and
			 more than 500 employees.

with an
			 application at such time and containing such information as the
shall require after establishing the criteria described in subsection (a).

text.#text: An employer seeking an award of recognition under this Act shall provide the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may assess a reasonable application fee on employers seeking such an award.

text.#text:
There is established in the Treasury of the United States a separate account for the deposit of
			 fees collected under this subsection to be known as the Employment Salute
			 Award Fund.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall deposit any fees collected pursuant to paragraph (1) into the Fund established
			 by paragraph (2).

, as provided in
			 paragraph (5), for making expenditures to carry out the program
			 established pursuant to subsection (a).

text.#text: Amounts in the Employment Salute Award Fund shall be available to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text:
an
			 amount equal to the total amount collected during the previous fiscal year
			 from fees assessed pursuant to this subsection. Such amounts are
			 authorized to remain available until expended

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#text: from the Employment Salute Award Fund

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for
			 each fiscal year in which fees are collected under this

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Honoring the Hiring of Heroes Act/s:2/ss:e

text.#text:
Fees authorized under paragraph (1) shall be collected and available for obligation only to the
			 extent and in the amount provided in advance in appropriations Acts.

shall publicize the recipients of the award by listing such recipients in a separate

text.#text:
An award granted under a program established pursuant to subsection (a) shall be for recognition
			 only and not be monetary in nature.
